column2: ALASKA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column8: Round

column2: 2. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column10: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 3. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column8: emergency flashers.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
column6: Stay on the main highway if possible
column8: Detour to the right

column2: 5. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column8: possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 6. A Blood Alcohol Content (BAC) of _____ is evidence of intoxication.
7. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.
column6: look both ways before crossing the tracks.
column8: be alert and obey all traffic signals.

column2: 8. An orange sign with black letters means:
column8: Stop

column2: 9. After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children you should:
column8: watch for children walking along the side of the road.

column2: 10. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column6: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column8: signal.

column2: 11. If you arrive at an uncontrolled intersection at the same time as another vehicle:
column4: the car on the left has the right-of-way.
column6: the car on the right should yield to the car on the left.
column8: the car on the left should yield to the car on the right.
column10: any vehicle already in the intersection should yield to the car on the right.

column2: 12. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.
column8: Â A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column8: Playground warning

column2: 14. Directional signals must be given:
column4: when there is other traffic in sight.
column6: when changing directions or suddenly reducing speed.
column8: when in city traffic only.
column10: only when there is traffic to the rear of your vehicle.

column2: 15. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column8: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column10: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.

column2: 16. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column8: are less important than

column2: 17. To enter a freeway:
column4: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column6: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column8: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column10: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.

column2: 18. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: turn left into the one-way road.
column6: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column10: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.

column2: 19. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column6: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.
column8: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.

column2: 20. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.
column8: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
